physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Dysarthric speech, marked limitation of upward gaze, mild facial asymmetry, absent gag reflex, depressed deep-tendon reflexes, silent plantar response. Mentation intact.

Ophthalmoplegia, intubation due to labored respiration. Mildly slurred but fluent speech at examination; pupils nonreactive to light; bilateral ptosis with total ophthalmoplegia; symmetrical mild facial weakness; absent gag reflex; tongue midline; motor strength 5/5 bilaterally; normal sensory findings; deep-tendon reflexes 1+. No pathological reflexes noted.
Increased respiratory insufficiency led to intubation; spinal tap showed clear fluid with WBC count of 2 cells/mL, chloride 127 mg/dL, glucose 123 mg/dL, protein 39 mg/dL.

Frontal headaches, hoarse and slurred speech, blurred and double vision, difficulty swallowing, constipation, generalized weakness; mildly slurred but fluent speech, bilateral ptosis, total ophthalmoplegia, symmetrical mild facial weakness, absent gag reflex, motor strength 5/5 bilaterally, normal sensory findings, deep-tendon reflexes 1+.
